key_points: The second impeachment trial of former president Donald Trump involved more than 27 hours of proceedings and over 140,000 words in the record.
Analysis by the Washington Post shows House impeachment managers spoke over 91,000 words, while Trump's legal team contributed almost 33,000 words.
Unlike Trump's first impeachment trial, the speaking time in the second trial was more evenly distributed among speakers.
Rep. Jamie B. Raskin was the lead impeachment manager, speaking just over 26,000 words.
Other notable speakers included Rep. David N. Cicilline, Rep. Joe Neguse, Del. Stacey Plaskett, and Trump's lawyers David Schoen, Bruce L. Castor Jr., and Michael T. van der Veen.
Trump's defense team used only one-third of the time compared to the House managers during opening arguments.
Both sides relied heavily on video presentations during their opening arguments.
Senate Majority Leader Charles E. Schumer spoke 1,256 words, primarily on procedural motions.
Sen. Mike Lee and Sen. Patrick J. Leahy also contributed significantly to the word count, with Leahy presiding over the trial.
Videos, testimonials, and audio footage from the January 6 events were important elements of the House managers' strategy.
spokespersons: Rep. Jamie B. Raskin (D-Md., Lead Impeachment Manager)
Rep. Adam B. Schiff (D-Calif., Lead Impeachment Manager during first trial)
Rep. David N. Cicilline (D-R.I., Impeachment Manager)
Del. Stacey Plaskett (D-Virgin Islands, Impeachment Manager)
Michael T. van der Veen (Trump Lawyer)
Charles E. Schumer (D-N.Y., Senate Majority Leader)
